sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The rich farmers ruine; vvho murmured at the plenty of the seasons, because he could not sell corn so dear as his covetous heart desired. To the tune of, Why are my eyes still flowing, as it is play'd on the violin. This may be printed, R.P
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for J. Back, at the Black Boy on London-Bridge, near the draw-bridge., [London] : [between 1685-1688]
Date and place of publication suggested by Wing. Verse: "A wealthy man a farmer, who had corn great store ..." Item at A5:2[311] trimmed. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
=======
